text:
Hey guys, let me show you how to tenderize
meat. Tenderizing is a great technique to get the most from your meat.

First off, mechanical
tenderisation involves piercing or pounding the meat.

Simply place it between two sheets of greaseproof
paper and smash it. It works fine when you

want your meat thin and tender. Now the way
to tenderise it is to marinate the meat

using a liquid that can be acidic solutions like lemon, lime, vinegar. And
use fruit juice from pineapple, paprya and

kiwi for example. Or diary products like milk,
buttermilk or yogurt. To do so place the milk

inside a zip up bag, add the liquid and give it a nice massage.
Stick that in the fridge to chill for at least

two hours. And that is how to tenderise meat,
if you want more tips, click on the link.
